etymology.description: 士(士) (shì, 'scholar') + 攵(攴) (pū, 'to tap') = a scholar releasing or annulling something
etymology.interpretation: The character combines 士(士) (shì, 'scholar') for the sound with 攵(攴) (pū, 'to tap'), suggesting the notion of releasing or annulling as if one were tapping away responsibilities or duties.

examples.chinese: 经过一番努力(經過一番努力)，他终于𠬤了心中的重负(他終於𠬤了心中的重負)。
examples.pinyin: Jīngguò yī fān nǔlì, tā zhōngyú shì le xīnzhōng de zhòngfù.
examples.english: After much effort, he finally released the heavy burden in his heart.

examples.chinese: 春风吹拂时(春風吹拂時)，人们放𠬤了心头的重荷(人們放𠬤了心頭的重荷)。
examples.pinyin: Chūnfēng chuīfú shí, rénmen fàng shì le xīntóu de zhònghé.
examples.english: When the spring breeze blows, people release the heavy load from their hearts.

examples.chinese: 烦闷时刻(煩悶時刻)，他选择𠬤心中的忧愁(他選擇𠬤心中的憂愁)。
examples.pinyin: Fánmèn shíkè, tā xuǎnzé shì xīnzhōng de yōuchóu.
examples.english: In moments of melancholy, he chooses to release the sorrow in his heart.
